How do fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or liquidity pool usage work on a new blockchain created with Verus?

All fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain has full control over its fees, and Verus does not take a cut.

in, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network and back, with all features and currencies of the public chain but none of the access. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. What is the purpose of setting minimum participation levels for crowdfunding currency launches on Verus?

Setting minimum participation levels for crowdfunding currency launches on Verus ensures that if the minimum levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, minus network fees. This provides a safeguard for participants and ensures that launches are successful.

What features are available for crowdfunding currency launches on Verus?

Verus offers a range of features for crowdfunding currency launches, including:

* Setting required minimum levels of worldwide participation in preferred currencies
* Automatic refunds if minimums are not met
* Maximum participation limits in one or more currencies
* Pre-launch discounts
* Price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs
* Price-neutral carve-outs of proceeds
* Vesting schedules in pre-allocations using VerusIDs

What is the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what are its benefits?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a decentralized network that allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. This enables the creation of public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains. The benefits of this network include:

* Unlimited scalability
* Interoperability between blockchains
* Easy setup of private blockchains with bridging of public currencies
* Decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation using Notary IDs
* No limit on the number of blockchains that can operate and interoperate on the Verus network
